description: postgres exporter Dashboard for display important postgreSQL metric

panels.description:
Max Replication lag behind master in seconds

Only available on a standby system.

Source: pg_last_xact_replay_timestamp

Use: pg_stat_replication for Details.
panels.title: Max Replication Lag

panels.description: Shared buffer hits vs reads from disc
panels.title: Shared Buffer Hits

panels.description:
Transactions committed + roolback per minute

Source: pg_stat_database,xact_commit + xact_rollback
panels.title: Transaction rate

panels.description:
Statements executed per Minute.

Source: pg_stat_statements.calls
panels.title: Query rate

panels.description:
Size of all databases in $Instance.

Source: pg_database_size()
panels.title: Total database size

panels.description: 1 Minute rate of transactions committed or rollback.
panels.title: Transactions

panels.description:
* blk_read_time: Time spent reading data file blocks by backends in this database, in milliseconds
* blk_write_time: Time spent writing data file blocks by backends in this database, in milliseconds

track_io_timings needs to be activated
panels.title: I/O Read/Write time

panels.description:
Source: pg_stat_database

* tup_fetched: rows needed to satisfy queries
* tup_returned: rows read/scanned
panels.title: Tuples fetched/returned

panels.description:
Should be 0 

Source: pg_stat_database

With log_lock_waits turned on, deadlocks will be logged to the PostgreSQL Logfiles.
panels.title: Deadlocks by database

panels.description: Should be 0. If temporary files are created, it can indicate insufficient work_mem. With log_temp_files the creation of temporary files are logged to the PostgreSQL Logfiles.
panels.title: Temporary files by database

panels.description:
Lag behind master in seconds.

Only available on a standby System.
panels.title: Replication lag

title: PostgreSQL Exporter
